problem_text: In the figure, m \angle 1 = 4 p + 15, m \angle 3 = 3 p - 10 and m \angle 4 = 6 r + 5. Find the value of p.
proof:
Step 1:
Theorem: Known facts
Premises : start
Conclusions: ∠JAK, B on DH, EH || IJ, ∠BAJ, ∠CAB, ∠JCL, A on CJ, ∠DCA, ∠DCI, ∠HDL, ∠EBK, C on IJ, D on CF, ∠IAG, D on FL, ∠JAK, ∠ACL, 3.14 = pi, pi * ((15 + 4 * p) / 180) = ∠BAJ, ∠ACL, C on AI, D on BE, pi * ((3 * p - 10) / 180) = ∠HBA, C on DL, ∠KAJ, ∠EDL, B on AG, ∠CAB, ∠KAC, pi * ((5 + 6 * r) / 180) = ∠BDC, FL || GK, ∠LCI, ∠LDE, ∠ICD, ∠FDH, A on BK, ∠HBK, ∠CAG, ∠FCJ, ∠BDL, ∠ACD, ∠EDL, ∠KAI, ∠KBE, ∠ICD

Step 2:
Theorem: Reverse Angle Definition
Premises : ∠JAK
Conclusions: ∠JAK = 2 * pi - ∠KAJ

Step 3:
Theorem: Alternate Interior Angle Theorem
Premises : EH || IJ
Conclusions: ∠HBA = ∠IAB, ∠ABE = ∠BAJ, ∠HDC = ∠ICD, ∠EDC = ∠JCD, ∠CDE = ∠DCJ, ∠EBA = ∠JAB

Step 4:
Theorem: Corresponding Angle Theorem
Premises : EH || IJ
Conclusions: ∠KAI = ∠KBE, ∠LCI = ∠LDE, ∠FCJ = ∠FDH

Step 5:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : ∠JCL, A on CJ
Conclusions: ∠ACL = ∠JCL

Step 6:
Theorem: Reverse Angle Definition
Premises : ∠DCI
Conclusions: ∠DCI = 2 * pi - ∠ICD

Step 7:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : ∠HDL, B on DH
Conclusions: ∠BDL = ∠HDL

Step 8:
Theorem: Reverse Angle Definition
Premises : ∠ACL
Conclusions: ∠ACL = 2 * pi - ∠LCA

Step 9:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : C on AI, ∠IAG
Conclusions: ∠CAG = ∠IAG

Step 10:
Theorem: Vertical Angle Theorem
Premises : D on FL, D on BE
Conclusions: ∠BDL = ∠EDF

Step 11:
Theorem: Vertical Angle Theorem
Premises : C on AI, C on DL
Conclusions: ∠ACD = ∠ICL

Step 12:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : C on DL, ∠HDL
Conclusions: ∠HDC = ∠HDL

Step 13:
Theorem: Vertical Angle Theorem
Premises : C on DL, C on IJ
Conclusions: ∠ICL = ∠JCD

Step 14:
Theorem: Reverse Angle Definition
Premises : ∠KAJ
Conclusions: ∠KAJ = 2 * pi - ∠JAK

Step 15:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : ∠EDL, C on DL
Conclusions: ∠EDC = ∠EDL

Step 16:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : B on AG, ∠IAG
Conclusions: ∠IAB = ∠IAG

Step 17:
Theorem: Reverse Angle Definition
Premises : ∠CAB
Conclusions: ∠CAB = 2 * pi - ∠BAC

Step 18:
Theorem: Circumference Split
Premises : ∠BAJ, ∠JAK, ∠CAB, ∠KAC
Conclusions: 2 * pi = ∠BAJ + ∠CAB + ∠JAK + ∠KAC

Step 19:
Theorem: Alternate Interior Angle Theorem
Premises : FL || GK
Conclusions: ∠FDB = ∠KBD, ∠ACL = ∠CAG

Step 20:
Theorem: Corresponding Angle Theorem
Premises : FL || GK
Conclusions: ∠IAG = ∠ICF, ∠HBK = ∠HDL, ∠EBK = ∠EDL, ∠JAK = ∠JCL

Step 21:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : C on DL, ∠LDE
Conclusions: ∠CDE = ∠LDE

Step 22:
Theorem: Circumference Split
Premises : ∠LCI, ∠ICD, ∠DCA, ∠ACL
Conclusions: 2 * pi = ∠ACL + ∠DCA + ∠ICD + ∠LCI

Step 23:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : ∠FDH, B on DH
Conclusions: ∠FDB = ∠FDH

Step 24:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : ∠EBK, A on BK
Conclusions: ∠EBA = ∠EBK

Step 25:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : ∠HBK, A on BK
Conclusions: ∠HBA = ∠HBK

Step 26:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : B on AG, ∠CAG
Conclusions: ∠CAB = ∠CAG

Step 27:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : ∠FCJ, D on CF
Conclusions: ∠DCJ = ∠FCJ

Step 28:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : ∠BDL, C on DL
Conclusions: ∠BDC = ∠BDL

Step 29:
Theorem: Reverse Angle Definition
Premises : ∠ACD
Conclusions: ∠ACD = 2 * pi - ∠DCA

Step 30:
Theorem: Reverse Angle Definition
Premises : ∠EDL
Conclusions: ∠EDL = 2 * pi - ∠LDE

Step 31:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : C on AI, ∠KAI
Conclusions: ∠KAC = ∠KAI

Step 32:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : D on BE, ∠KBE
Conclusions: ∠KBD = ∠KBE

Step 33:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : ∠KBE, A on BK
Conclusions: ∠ABE = ∠KBE

Step 34:
Theorem: Reverse Angle Definition
Premises : ∠ICD
Conclusions: ∠ICD = 2 * pi - ∠DCI

Step 35:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠HBA = ∠IAB, pi * ((3 * p - 10) / 180) = ∠HBA
Conclusions: pi * ((3 * p - 10) / 180) = ∠IAB

Step 36:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : pi * ((15 + 4 * p) / 180) = ∠BAJ, ∠ABE = ∠BAJ
Conclusions: pi * ((15 + 4 * p) / 180) = ∠ABE

Step 37:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠IAG = ∠ICF, ∠CAG = ∠IAG
Conclusions: ∠CAG = ∠ICF

Step 38:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠CDE = ∠LDE, ∠CDE = ∠DCJ
Conclusions: ∠DCJ = ∠LDE

Step 39:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : 3.14 = pi, 2 * pi = ∠ACL + ∠DCA + ∠ICD + ∠LCI
Conclusions: 2 * 3.14 = ∠ACL + ∠DCA + ∠ICD + ∠LCI

Step 40:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠EBA = ∠EBK, ∠EBK = ∠EDL, ∠EBA = ∠JAB
Conclusions: ∠EDL = ∠JAB

Step 41:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠HBA = ∠HBK, pi * ((3 * p - 10) / 180) = ∠HBA, ∠HBK = ∠HDL
Conclusions: pi * ((3 * p - 10) / 180) = ∠HDL

Step 42:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠ACD = 2 * pi - ∠DCA, ∠ACD = ∠ICL
Conclusions: ∠ICL = 2 * pi - ∠DCA

Step 43:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : pi * ((15 + 4 * p) / 180) = ∠ABE, ∠ABE = ∠KBE
Conclusions: pi * ((15 + 4 * p) / 180) = ∠KBE

Step 44:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠EDL = ∠JAB, ∠EDC = ∠EDL, ∠EDC = ∠JCD
Conclusions: ∠JAB = ∠JCD

Step 45:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠BDL = ∠HDL, pi * ((3 * p - 10) / 180) = ∠HDL, ∠BDL = ∠EDF
Conclusions: pi * ((3 * p - 10) / 180) = ∠EDF

Step 46:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠HDC = ∠ICD, pi * ((3 * p - 10) / 180) = ∠HDL, ∠HDC = ∠HDL
Conclusions: pi * ((3 * p - 10) / 180) = ∠ICD

Step 47:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠KAI = ∠KBE, pi * ((15 + 4 * p) / 180) = ∠KBE
Conclusions: pi * ((15 + 4 * p) / 180) = ∠KAI

Step 48:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠KBD = ∠KBE, pi * ((15 + 4 * p) / 180) = ∠KBE
Conclusions: pi * ((15 + 4 * p) / 180) = ∠KBD

Step 49:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠EDL = ∠JAB, ∠JAB = ∠JCD
Conclusions: ∠EDL = ∠JCD

Step 50:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : pi * ((3 * p - 10) / 180) = ∠EDF, ∠BDL = ∠EDF
Conclusions: pi * ((3 * p - 10) / 180) = ∠BDL

Step 51:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠KAC = ∠KAI, pi * ((15 + 4 * p) / 180) = ∠KAI
Conclusions: pi * ((15 + 4 * p) / 180) = ∠KAC

Step 52:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : pi * ((15 + 4 * p) / 180) = ∠KBD, ∠FDB = ∠KBD
Conclusions: pi * ((15 + 4 * p) / 180) = ∠FDB

Step 53:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠EDL = ∠JCD, ∠ICL = ∠JCD
Conclusions: ∠EDL = ∠ICL

Step 54:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : pi * ((5 + 6 * r) / 180) = ∠BDC, pi * ((3 * p - 10) / 180) = ∠BDL, ∠BDC = ∠BDL
Conclusions: pi * ((5 + 6 * r) / 180) = pi * ((3 * p - 10) / 180)

Step 55:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠FDB = ∠FDH, pi * ((15 + 4 * p) / 180) = ∠FDB
Conclusions: pi * ((15 + 4 * p) / 180) = ∠FDH

Step 56:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠EDL = ∠ICL, ∠EDL = 2 * pi - ∠LDE
Conclusions: ∠ICL = 2 * pi - ∠LDE

Step 57:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : pi * ((5 + 6 * r) / 180) = pi * ((3 * p - 10) / 180), pi * ((3 * p - 10) / 180) = ∠IAB
Conclusions: pi * ((5 + 6 * r) / 180) = ∠IAB

Step 58:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : pi * ((5 + 6 * r) / 180) = pi * ((3 * p - 10) / 180), pi * ((3 * p - 10) / 180) = ∠EDF
Conclusions: pi * ((5 + 6 * r) / 180) = ∠EDF

Step 59:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : pi * ((3 * p - 10) / 180) = ∠ICD, pi * ((5 + 6 * r) / 180) = pi * ((3 * p - 10) / 180)
Conclusions: pi * ((5 + 6 * r) / 180) = ∠ICD

Step 60:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : pi * ((15 + 4 * p) / 180) = ∠FDH, ∠FCJ = ∠FDH
Conclusions: pi * ((15 + 4 * p) / 180) = ∠FCJ

Step 61:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠IAG = ∠ICF, ∠IAB = ∠IAG, pi * ((5 + 6 * r) / 180) = ∠IAB
Conclusions: pi * ((5 + 6 * r) / 180) = ∠ICF

Step 62:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : 3.14 = pi, pi * ((5 + 6 * r) / 180) = ∠EDF
Conclusions: 3.14 * ((5 + 6 * r) / 180) = ∠EDF

Step 63:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : pi * ((15 + 4 * p) / 180) = ∠FCJ, ∠DCJ = ∠FCJ
Conclusions: pi * ((15 + 4 * p) / 180) = ∠DCJ

Step 64:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠CAG = ∠ICF, pi * ((5 + 6 * r) / 180) = ∠ICF
Conclusions: pi * ((5 + 6 * r) / 180) = ∠CAG

Step 65:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 3.14 * ((5 + 6 * r) / 180) = ∠EDF, pi * ((5 + 6 * r) / 180) = ∠EDF
Conclusions: 3.14 * ((5 + 6 * r) / 180) = pi * ((5 + 6 * r) / 180)

Step 66:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠DCJ = ∠LDE, pi * ((15 + 4 * p) / 180) = ∠DCJ
Conclusions: pi * ((15 + 4 * p) / 180) = ∠LDE

Step 67:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠CAB = ∠CAG, pi * ((5 + 6 * r) / 180) = ∠CAG
Conclusions: pi * ((5 + 6 * r) / 180) = ∠CAB

Step 68:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : pi * ((5 + 6 * r) / 180) = ∠CAG, ∠ACL = ∠CAG
Conclusions: pi * ((5 + 6 * r) / 180) = ∠ACL

Step 69:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : pi * ((5 + 6 * r) / 180) = pi * ((3 * p - 10) / 180), 3.14 * ((5 + 6 * r) / 180) = pi * ((5 + 6 * r) / 180)
Conclusions: 3.14 * ((5 + 6 * r) / 180) = pi * ((3 * p - 10) / 180)

Step 70:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 3.14 * ((5 + 6 * r) / 180) = pi * ((5 + 6 * r) / 180), pi * ((5 + 6 * r) / 180) = ∠ICD
Conclusions: 3.14 * ((5 + 6 * r) / 180) = ∠ICD

Step 71:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠LCI = ∠LDE, pi * ((15 + 4 * p) / 180) = ∠LDE
Conclusions: pi * ((15 + 4 * p) / 180) = ∠LCI

Step 72:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : 3.14 = pi, pi * ((15 + 4 * p) / 180) = ∠LDE
Conclusions: 3.14 * ((15 + 4 * p) / 180) = ∠LDE

Step 73:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : pi * ((5 + 6 * r) / 180) = ∠CAB, 3.14 * ((5 + 6 * r) / 180) = pi * ((5 + 6 * r) / 180)
Conclusions: 3.14 * ((5 + 6 * r) / 180) = ∠CAB

Step 74:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 3.14 * ((5 + 6 * r) / 180) = pi * ((5 + 6 * r) / 180), pi * ((5 + 6 * r) / 180) = ∠ACL
Conclusions: 3.14 * ((5 + 6 * r) / 180) = ∠ACL

Step 75:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠ACL = ∠JCL, pi * ((5 + 6 * r) / 180) = ∠ACL
Conclusions: pi * ((5 + 6 * r) / 180) = ∠JCL

Step 76:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : 3.14 = pi, 3.14 * ((5 + 6 * r) / 180) = pi * ((3 * p - 10) / 180)
Conclusions: 3.14 * ((5 + 6 * r) / 180) = 3.14 * ((3 * p - 10) / 180)

Step 77:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠ICD = 2 * pi - ∠DCI, 3.14 * ((5 + 6 * r) / 180) = ∠ICD
Conclusions: 3.14 * ((5 + 6 * r) / 180) = 2 * pi - ∠DCI

Step 78:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : 3.14 = pi, pi * ((15 + 4 * p) / 180) = ∠LCI
Conclusions: 3.14 * ((15 + 4 * p) / 180) = ∠LCI

Step 79:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : 3.14 * ((15 + 4 * p) / 180) = ∠LDE, ∠ICL = 2 * pi - ∠LDE, 3.14 = pi
Conclusions: 2 * 3.14 - 3.14 * ((15 + 4 * p) / 180) = ∠ICL

Step 80:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 3.14 * ((15 + 4 * p) / 180) = ∠LDE, pi * ((15 + 4 * p) / 180) = ∠LDE
Conclusions: 3.14 * ((15 + 4 * p) / 180) = pi * ((15 + 4 * p) / 180)

Step 81:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 3.14 * ((5 + 6 * r) / 180) = ∠CAB, ∠CAB = 2 * pi - ∠BAC
Conclusions: 3.14 * ((5 + 6 * r) / 180) = 2 * pi - ∠BAC

Step 82:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠ACL = 2 * pi - ∠LCA, 3.14 * ((5 + 6 * r) / 180) = ∠ACL
Conclusions: 3.14 * ((5 + 6 * r) / 180) = 2 * pi - ∠LCA

Step 83:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠JAK = ∠JCL, pi * ((5 + 6 * r) / 180) = ∠JCL
Conclusions: pi * ((5 + 6 * r) / 180) = ∠JAK

Step 84:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 3.14 * ((5 + 6 * r) / 180) = 3.14 * ((3 * p - 10) / 180), 3.14 * ((5 + 6 * r) / 180) = 2 * pi - ∠DCI
Conclusions: 3.14 * ((3 * p - 10) / 180) = 2 * pi - ∠DCI

Step 85:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠ICL = 2 * pi - ∠DCA, 2 * 3.14 - 3.14 * ((15 + 4 * p) / 180) = ∠ICL
Conclusions: 2 * 3.14 - 3.14 * ((15 + 4 * p) / 180) = 2 * pi - ∠DCA

Step 86:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : pi * ((15 + 4 * p) / 180) = ∠BAJ, 3.14 * ((15 + 4 * p) / 180) = pi * ((15 + 4 * p) / 180)
Conclusions: 3.14 * ((15 + 4 * p) / 180) = ∠BAJ

Step 87:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : pi * ((15 + 4 * p) / 180) = ∠KAC, 3.14 * ((15 + 4 * p) / 180) = pi * ((15 + 4 * p) / 180)
Conclusions: 3.14 * ((15 + 4 * p) / 180) = ∠KAC

Step 88:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 3.14 * ((5 + 6 * r) / 180) = 3.14 * ((3 * p - 10) / 180), 3.14 * ((5 + 6 * r) / 180) = 2 * pi - ∠BAC
Conclusions: 3.14 * ((3 * p - 10) / 180) = 2 * pi - ∠BAC

Step 89:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 3.14 * ((5 + 6 * r) / 180) = 2 * pi - ∠LCA, 3.14 * ((5 + 6 * r) / 180) = 3.14 * ((3 * p - 10) / 180)
Conclusions: 3.14 * ((3 * p - 10) / 180) = 2 * pi - ∠LCA

Step 90:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : 3.14 = pi, pi * ((5 + 6 * r) / 180) = ∠JAK
Conclusions: 3.14 * ((5 + 6 * r) / 180) = ∠JAK

Step 91:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠JAK = 2 * pi - ∠KAJ, 3.14 * ((5 + 6 * r) / 180) = ∠JAK
Conclusions: 3.14 * ((5 + 6 * r) / 180) = 2 * pi - ∠KAJ

Step 92:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 3.14 * ((5 + 6 * r) / 180) = 2 * pi - ∠KAJ, 3.14 * ((5 + 6 * r) / 180) = 3.14 * ((3 * p - 10) / 180)
Conclusions: 3.14 * ((3 * p - 10) / 180) = 2 * pi - ∠KAJ

Step 93:
Theorem: Solve Linear Equation System
Premises : ∠ACL = 2 * pi - ∠LCA, 2 * pi = ∠BAJ + ∠CAB + ∠JAK + ∠KAC, ∠CAB = 2 * pi - ∠BAC, ∠DCI = 2 * pi - ∠ICD, 3.14 * ((3 * p - 10) / 180) = 2 * pi - ∠BAC, 3.14 * ((3 * p - 10) / 180) = 2 * pi - ∠KAJ, ∠KAJ = 2 * pi - ∠JAK, 3.14 * ((15 + 4 * p) / 180) = ∠BAJ, 3.14 * ((15 + 4 * p) / 180) = ∠KAC, 2 * 3.14 - 3.14 * ((15 + 4 * p) / 180) = 2 * pi - ∠DCA, 2 * 3.14 = ∠ACL + ∠DCA + ∠ICD + ∠LCI, 3.14 * ((3 * p - 10) / 180) = 2 * pi - ∠DCI, 3.14 * ((15 + 4 * p) / 180) = ∠LCI, 3.14 * ((3 * p - 10) / 180) = 2 * pi - ∠LCA
Conclusions: 25 = p
logic_fomrs_refined: Equals(MeasureOf(Angle(B, A, J)), Mul(pi, Div(Add(Mul(4.0, p), 15.0), 180.0)))
Equals(MeasureOf(Angle(H, B, A)), Mul(pi, Div(Sub(Mul(3.0, p), 10.0), 180.0)))
Equals(MeasureOf(Angle(B, D, C)), Mul(pi, Div(Add(Mul(6.0, r), 5.0), 180.0)))
